February 171 I960
O'
Hr. James S. Miles
Director
W8AA Fadlo - TV Unit
Lafayette, Indiana
Dear Jim:
Leafing through my moldy old communiques I
came across a short note from you relative to whether
we should attempt to hold a Begion III convocation
this year.
Obviously we did not get around to discussing
this at the Chicago get-together, but I should like
to Indicate that I’m all In favor of it....providing
Headquarters has available funds. I am of the Impression
that we would have to alternate among the regions to
some extent because of financial stringencies, but if
It can be managed I would certainly favor holding a
Beglon III meeting. There are good reasons for taking
the position that every one of the regions should hold
a meeting this particular year of decision. As a
democratic-membership based association It. is imperative
that the officers have the full support of the member¬
ship In making major moves. Although I feel I got
considerable general sanction at the regional meetings
I attended last year In favor of the move to Washington,
the radio network disposal to the Center may be quite a
different thing. There are already some indications in
this early stage of negotiations that some of our member¬
ship are unhappy about such a prospect and may break away
and begin splinter networks of their own. Some of this
may be largely emotionalism and can be diminished considerably
If we have an opportunity to talk these things over at regional
meetings and explain the facts of life behind the proposed
move to them*
So, I’m for It...but not at Kellogg, the robbers!
Cordially,
William G* Harley
WGHicp
